not the first man to lay his mouth on a

basically this album is a series of solo

single takes with no overdubs in the
recording process of this album even
though we're talking about one
instrument here two dozen microphones
were used to produce this thing these
microphones are not only recording
what's going on outside of the saxophone
the sounds were usually used to hearing
but also what's going on inside yeah you
hear tones in these instrumental pieces
but you're also hearing really weird

you're hearing Colin breathing weird

and from what I've read in the press

now that I go back and look up this

Kirk but anyway to hear Colin go on four
two three four you in five minutes with

technical ability isn't everything there
are plenty of albums with a lot of

not for one second outside of Stetsons

the sounds the production just the

nicely really beautifully at some points
there are a lot of moments here where

so well it sounds like electronic music
to me judges the title track home Red

me it's one instrument but with the way
the microphones are placed and the way
this thing is mixed it's like you're
hearing three or four different
instruments at once but there still are
a lot of moments here where you know it
sounds like a saxophone it doesn't feel
like you're inside of the instrument it
sounds like maybe you're the the one
person sitting inside a gigantic empty
Hall and Collins sounds are just

the

the compositions that Colin puts

but if you're looking for an album that
